snippet: The sport’s most influential group has introduced a reform to repair racing’s much-damaged credibility.
abstract: Editorial points out the Jockey Club, horse racing's most influential group, has introduced a reform to repair sport's much-damaged credibility over destructive and widespread doping of racehorses; notes reform will require use of more thorough 'out-of-competition' drug-testing of horses; warns federal crackdown could occur if horse racing fails at self-reform.
lead_paragraph: The sport’s most influential group has introduced a reform to repair racing’s much-damaged credibility.
